content: **___** **___** <big><big><big>**ruby blue**</big></big></big> <big>the yarn for this design reminded me of my maternal grandmother she was a graceful and stylish lady who lived through the blue rinse era </big> <big>the lace panel emerges from the toe and flows all the way to the cuff creating a delicate effect </big> <big>this is a pretty and relatively simple design </big> <big>these socks are worked toe up and feature a wedge toe and eye of partridge heel turn and flap </big> **___** **___** <big>**pattern information**</big> <big>**sizing**</big> a-56 b-60 c-64 d-68 e-72 f-76 g-80 sts finished circumference approx 15 5 16 5 18 19 20 21 22 cm/6 25 6 75 7 7 5 8 8 5 9 inches <big>**yarn**</big> 100g fingering weight sock yarn solid semi-solid or tonal colourways would work well for this design <big>**gauge**</big> worked in the round and measured after washing and laying flat to dry 36 sts = 10 cm/4 inches over stockinette stitch <big>**needles**</big> for working small circumference in the round 2 25 mm/us1 needles or size required to achieve gauge <big>**pattern formats** </big> the instructions for the construction of the socks are written and the lace panel is both charted and written **low vision accessible** a low vision accessible version of this pattern are also available this version include 24 point arial all black text no italics no columns or tables and fully written instructions there are charts included but the charts are not needed to complete the pattern <big>**thank you**</big> thank you to shahmallow elchkitty joycoleman kimssmile bells5r1 iriknit1 ciscavm ninima and other testers a huge thanks also to yarnymama and yalta for their ongoing valued advice guidance feedback and encouragement
